page.title: 03HOUSES IN THE AREA
page.content: There are a number of manor houses (Walford,Monkton,Gotton,Hestercombe and Langaller) Walford House is now split into flats; they are leased out to tenants.Monkton House has freehold flats.Gotton House has been made into an old people's home. Langaller House is a normal residence.Hestercombe now houses the fire brigade. Many of the houses in the area are converted farm buildings;old barns, farmhouses,and stables have become valuable property.Two old mills have also been converted.The one at Creech has been split into 2 houses (Mill Cottage & Mill House)Mill House has been extended and developed. New housing estates have been built since the war. These estates contain two types of building, bunglows for old and retired people and new houses for young families.
